author: Shao Trommashere(They/She)🏳️‍🌈❤💌
text:
Roe and Casey used Griswold and Eisenstadt as prescidence which allowed it to pass.

Hope this helps!

author: Shao Trommashere(They/She)🏳️‍🌈❤💌
text:
The right to use contraceptives came prior to Roe and Casey. The decision Griswold v. Connecticut struck down a Comstock Law that forbade the use of any birth control, including condoms *in a marriage*.

Eisenstadt gave everyone equal access to birth control regardless. https://t.co/EE1lMsjY4D

author: Shao Trommashere(They/She)🏳️‍🌈❤💌
text: All this to say, let the kid(s) make the decision on what to call the step grandparent and how they want the relationship to play out.

author: Shao Trommashere(They/She)🏳️‍🌈❤💌
text: Now, my sister’s kids (Sister was adopted just like me and her BioMom is still in her life but has minimal contact as that was her choice…) call our Mom Aunt Ness or GMa depending on how they feel that day.

author: Shao Trommashere(They/She)🏳️‍🌈❤💌
text: On my GMa (Kate was my GPa’s mistress) and about my parents and Uncles (the uncles that weren’t kids from their marriage).

author: Shao Trommashere(They/She)🏳️‍🌈❤💌
text: I finally settled on Aunt Kate. It seemed respectful enough w/o taking anything from her and it felt like a natural honorific. It also highlighted the fact that she never really treated me well bc I wasn’t a “real grandkid” bc I was adopted and she’d talk shit

author: Shao Trommashere(They/She)🏳️‍🌈❤💌
text: Once I was old enough to really understand what was up, I made the decision to build a relationship with Kate, but I was kinda stuck on what to call her…it didn’t feel natural to call her GMa, but I couldn’t just call her Kate.

author: Shao Trommashere(They/She)🏳️‍🌈❤💌
text:
My take using my own personal experience:

My Dad’s parents divorced before I was born. My GMa never remarried (or dated as far as I know) while my GPa remarried. I was close to my GMa and GPa, but I wasn’t particularly close to my GPa’s new wife, Kate. https://t.co/Se6bGyfzOn
